conclusion: Identify all forces acting on the bead: Weight (mg, vertically downward), Electric force (Fe = qE, horizontal), String tension (T, along the string)
Resolve the tension into components: Vertical component (T cos θ, upward), Horizontal component (T sin θ, toward the field direction)
Impose equilibrium: Vertical balance (T cos θ = mg), Horizontal balance (T sin θ = qE)
Eliminate T by dividing horizontal balance by vertical balance: (T sin θ)/(T cos θ) = (qE)/(mg), resulting in tan θ = qE / (mg)
Solve for the electric-field magnitude: E = (mg/q) tan θ
Determine the direction of the electric field: Horizontal, opposite to the displacement of the charged bead if q is positive
